noun.description: A written or spoken agreement, especially one concerning employment, sales, or tenancy, that is intended to be enforceable by law.
examples: both parties must sign employment contracts
a network of doctors and hospitals under contract to provide services

verb.description: Decrease in size, number, or range.
Enter into a formal and legally binding agreement.
examples: the local authority will contract with a wide range of agencies to provide services

verb.description: Catch or develop (a disease or infectious agent)
examples: three people contracted a killer virus

origin: Middle English: via Old French from Latin contractus, from contract- drawn together, tightened, from the verb contrahere, from con- together + trahere draw.
